intro: Triocles, commonly known as the three-leaved plant, is a unique species characterized by its trifoliate leaves, which consist of three leaflets arranged symmetrically. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, also known as the carrot or parsley family, and is native to temperate regions of Europe and Asia. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with slender stems and small white or yellow flowers that bloom in umbels. Its leaves are often used in traditional herbal medicine for their purported digestive and anti-inflammatory properties.
